content: WASHINGTON  March 31 The U.S. Department of Justice on Thursday said it will require data management firm Iron Mountain Inc to divest its records management assets as a condition for acquiring its Australian rival Recall Holdings Ltd.
name: Iron Mountain Incorporated
title: U.S. says Iron Mountain must divest assets to acquire Recall Holdings

content: SYDNEY U.S. data management company Iron Mountain Inc  will sell its Australian unit to ease regulatory concerns hampering its A$2.7 billion ($2 billion) buyout of Sydney-listed rival Recall Holdings Ltd   a regulator said.

title: U.S.-based Iron Mountain to sell Australian assets for acquisition: regulator

content: SYDNEY  March 10 U.S. data management company Iron Mountain Inc will sell its Australian unit to ease regulatory concerns hampering its A$2.7 billion ($2 billion) buyout of Sydney-listed rival Recall Holdings Ltd  a regulator said.
name: Iron Mountain Incorporated
title: U.S.-based Iron Mountain to sell Australian assets for acquisition - regulator

content: SYDNEY  Nov 5 Australia's competition regulator said an agreed A$2.7 billion ($1.9 billion) buyout of data management firm Recall Holdings Ltd by U.S. rival Iron Mountain Inc may hurt competition  drive up prices and lower customer service.
name: Iron Mountain Incorporated
title: Australian watchdog casts doubt over Recall takeover

content: Australia-listed data protection services provider Recall Holdings Ltd  is seeking to renegotiate a $2.2 billion deal to be acquired by document and data storage services company Iron Mountain Inc   according to people familiar with the matter.
name: Iron Mountain Incorporated
title: Exclusive: Recall Holdings seeks to renegotiate Iron Mountain deal - sources
